page.title: 15Historic Houses
page.content: There is a number of fine, old houses, originally surrounded by estates and farms. Wickham Place was built in the early 18th. century. A wing was added during the 19th. century. The 50 acre estate is slightly smaller than originally. The family rents out fields, but does not farm directly. Cricket bats used to be made from willows on the estate. The river runs nearby, and fishing is private. Wickham Hall is a large farm-house with a 380 acre farm. The Hall was built in the early 1700's on the site of the residence of the Bishop of London. It was later bought by the ancestors of the present owners. It has a large garden, with rare flowers and trees. The moat is filled from an underground spring. A boat-house nearby has very old stained glass windows.
